comment: She is a sweet professor and the assignments are very easy, but she's pretty impossible to reach. She never responds to any emails, and I've had several issues with assignments online and they still exist because she does not respond. The class is easy, but the professor is pretty MIA.

Ya'll Professor Jess is so easy to talk to and so willing to help. Math is a really tough subject for me. She literally gave me alternative assignments to make it accessible. She is so passionate and just wants us to learn however is best. I am so grateful for everything she did to help me succeed, with and without accommodations. Take her courses

Professor Jess truly cares for her students and expressed the desire to make sure we all succeeded. Pretty easy class with cool group activities. here's a reading reflection due every week, but she usually gives you time in class to complete it. There's also only three exams, but if you don't get a perfect score, you have to retake it.

Attendance is taken on an app. You pick how you earn your grade (point system). 8 khan academys, 3 tests (5 questions and taken at home), and 9 reading responses. She views u as a person and not a student. Love her!!! I felt like her kid lol.

Such a great teacher-taking her again for two classes next semester.Kind and truly cares about her students and wants you to do your best. I went into her class not liking math,and now I look forward to her class. One reading response and Khan Academy due each week.Not hard at all.Take home assessments,can redo if you don't get the grade you want.
Just like every other review Hale is amazing. My favorite professor I've taken in the elementary education program. Her grading system makes it so easy to get an A. She is the best
EXTREMELY easy to work with. If she is an option for a course, that's who I am going to take it with. She is fair and actually cares about her students.

Jess is such a sweet person and genuinely cares about your wellbeing. She is incredibly understanding and wants the best for all of her students. Her grading system is different but you get used to it. The only class I was never stressed about.
Jess was a lovely professor! She is incredibly understanding and there are extra points built around the class which is nice. As long as you put in the work, you will pass!
Jess is awesome and this class is not hard at all. I do not think I have learned much besides what khan academy taught me but its easy

Hale was truly the best professor I have had at KSU. I took her for two courses and did not regret my choice. She truly cares about you as a student first and then your grade. She makes all of her students understands the content and goes above and beyond to answer any questions you may have. She is a very easy grader and gives you many extensions.

Jessica Hale is a Godsend. She literally is one of the best professors that I have had at Kennesaw. I would highly recommend taking her class. She is so understanding and will work with you so that you get the grade that you need and deserve. She is so caring and I can't ask for any better professor. Love Professor Hale to the moon
I love Jessica Hale! She is very caring and understands her students have outside lives. She supports her students in and outside of the classroom.
I love Professor Hale! I would take her again. She understands that you have a life outside of school. If you need anything you can just ask her.
Good professor and person but grading is a little difficult to understand and hard to know what grade you will end up with
She is extremely caring and very considerate for the fact that not every college student is just in school. I really enjoyed her teaching style and I would 100% choose her again if I had the choice.

If you are looking for a professor that will not only work with you and your challenges in math, as well as be there to support you in any way she can, then i definitely recommend Professor Jess! Being in her class made me feel like there are professors out there who still care about you and your well being FIRST. Very inclusive and welcoming class
She's great!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Legit the best teacher at this school. Treats you like an ACTUAL human being who goes to college, has a job, and has an outside life. She is very clear on her expectations and you always know what you are expected to do.

Summer class. Khan academy really taught me everything, she isn't lecture-based. Khan academy is individual to how you do on pre-test. She cares about mental health and wants you to ask questions but she doesn't always give you one bold answer on how to solve and teach these math concepts. It's a lot of self-discovery which can be annoying.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: I looooove Jessica! I have taken 3 classes with her already and she did amazing in all of them. Many people say they don't learn from her. You have to put in effort in her class to learn, which is how most classes are. She really cares about mental health and will do anything in her power to make sure her students are okay.

amazing. Ive taken her for two classes, and im currently in another class w/ her. she cares about her students so much! its a class where i feel safe and comfortable to speak and learn in. she doesnt overwhelm you, but she will make you get out of your comfort zone in a good day ! i learned valuable things during my time with her. shes great!

Jessica is a great professor because she knows what you need to be a great teacher. Her classroom is the safest environment and I came out of it finally understanding why math concepts work, not just how to teach them. She understands life happens and is not hard on attendance but it does count towards class in the end. A must take!!

Jessica is a wonderful lady! She is nice and caring. She is very understanding when it comes to personal issues and will work with you if you fall behind. Doesnt do letters grades until the end, but she always gives feedback!

Love her! I took her for ECE 4408 & now for MAED 3316. Doesn't believe in grades. Cares more about students & their well-being. Doesn't overwhelm us with work & makes this class relaxing. Individual meetings @ the end of the semester: students tell her what grade they want/deserve & that's ur final grade. Gonna take her for MAED 3317 in the summer.
Wonderful professor. Super cute, super caring. But TERRIBLE at responding outside of class.

Professor Hale was such a kind and caring Professor who cared so much about each and every one of her students! She made this class as stress free as possible and made sure she never overwhelmed us with too much work. This class is an easy A as long as you show up and do the work! Planning to take more of her classes.

Jessica is really nice as a person but I feel like I learned nothing in her class. As a future teacher, I take these education classes seriously and I feel like her class was a complete waste of time because she did not teach anything. I wish I learned how to actually teach. She also threw assignments at us the week classes ended which was unfair.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: This is my second class with Professor Hale. This is an easy class but I have not learned anything in both of the classes. There is a lot of group work and she expects you to work with your group to find the answers. However, she is available if you have questions. Super easy A but you may not learn much.

Jessica is awesome! She gives genuinely wants to know how we are doing and seriously cares about our well-being. The class is pretty chill. Homework was at khan academy which was sometimes a ton but it's all easy. Everyone would meet one week, the next week was only group A, and the next was only group B, and the 4th week was a breather week. Easy.

I'm a senior at KSU and Professor Hale is my absolute favorite Professor ever. She is the most kind and inspirational person you'll meet! I have taken two classes with her, and if I could take all of my math classes with her, I would. Take her class if you want a Professor who is passionate about education and genuinely cares about her students.

TAKE HER!!!! She is easily one of the best prof's at KSU. She is so caring and is willing to work with every single student. The material can be difficult but she teaches it in a way that every student can understand.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: She's the best professor I've ever met. I've also taken her for 3316. She really cares about her students and their mental health and well being. With Corona she was very worried about everyone and helpful with making the class manageable. She's willing to adjust her schedule and due dates if needed or to give extra time for submissions. TAKE HER!!
Professor Hale is loved by so many of us education majors. Amazing professor!
Professor Hale is an AMAZING teacher! She creates a safe and fun environment for her students to learn. She provides as much feedback as you need/want and is very personable!

TAKE PROFESSOR HALE she is the most caring and welcoming professor that I have ever had. She is always there to answer questions that you have. Her class isn't easy but if you attend the class you will pass.

I was never proficient at math; however, Jessica Hale used a plethora of techniques and various ways of explaining concepts which allowed for me to fully understand the content. She is one of the best teachers I have ever had the pleasure of knowing (at any level). She is extremely caring and will go the extra mile for her students. TAKE HER.
The absolute best professor I have ever had! I learned more about math in her class than I have in my entire life! I will take her for every class I possibly can!

Jessica is absolutely amazing and I wish I could take her every semester. She is so caring and kind and only wants to help you. Tests are untimed and there is lots of group work. She is the sweetest and kindest person I know and her class was much easier to handle than a regular math class. 10/10 recommend.

She's amazing and adorable and she has a way of helping everyone achieve "lightbulb moments" and she made me love this class. I've actually registered to take her again in the next class (3317) and I am so excited.

Very nice and caring professor. She's more worried about the well being of her students than about the crap from the school. Lots of in class projects. I would take her again. You don't learn much about math though, more about teaching in general.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Jessica is not only one of the most amazing professors I know, but also one of the most amazing people I know. She cares deeply about each of her students lives inside and outside the classroom, she believes all her students have the ability to do great math, and she simply just wants to make sure that all her students will be great math teachers.

She the most sweetest and nice person you can ever meet. She believes in EVERYONE and bend over backwards for you. She is highly respected. She make sure you understand the material and helps you strive for excellence. She gives homework for extra practice. I'm going to truly miss her and the fact that she cares about your schooling and your life.

Professor Hale is passionate about teaching mathematics to future educators. She is an ally for students within the education program and truly cares about student overall success. She provides opportunities for her students to achieve at their highest ability. She's kind and understanding, while structured and steadfast.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--GRADED BY FEW THINGS
